title: ActInf Livestream #050.2 ~ "Interoception as modeling, allostasis as control"
description:
Second participatory group discussion on the paper. 

"Interoception as modeling, allostasis as control"
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0301051121002350
Eli Sennesh, Jordan Theriault, Dana Brooks, Jan-Willem van de Meent, Lisa Feldman Barrett, Karen S. Quigley

00:00 Hello and welcome.
01:17 Introduction and welcome.
06:21 Why are cats scared of cucumbers.
09:16 Packing a parachute.
14:31 Ergodic vs Non-ergodic systems.
16:17 Systems that extend beyond the body.
26:41 Does the entity have a true interception.
38:35 Perspective swaps.
40:14 The importance of perspective swapping.
48:15 Social communication as control.
58:40 Physiological costs of multi - time framing.
1:03:15 How to deal with uncertainty.
1:06:45 What does uncertainty mean.
1:18:55 Active inference vs active inference.
1:29:48 Bridges and ramps.
1:33:38 Where do we go from here.
1:37:11 The metaphors we use to think about control.
1:42:55 The dodgeball metaphor.
1:49:56 Control systems thinking.
1:52:18 Mixed feedback control systems.
1:55:35 Perspective swap sessions
